此文档真实记录了从形成文章初稿(early drafts of articles)到投稿到文章发表的全过程。这个过程是辛苦的，需要参考新近阅读的文章，精彩的评论，经常引用的文章等，同时也有一时兴起的点子和想法。这里是截至到目前我个人发表的论文目录清单。

Rong Chen on dblp:computer science bibliography, Google Scholar Citations, arnetminer, and sites.google.

1资助(granters)及未发表的稿件

  • Short Bio (ca. 74 words)

Rong Chen: He received the M.S. and Ph.D. degree in computer software and theory from the Jilin University, China, in 1997 and 2000. He is currently a professor of the College of Information Science and Technology at the Dalian Maritime University, and has previously held position at Sun Yat-sen University, and TU Graz. His research interests are in computer vision and image processing, machine learning, collective intelligence, Internet and mobile computing.

1. Social Software Diagnosis (SSD) 

Originated from rchen14fse_1.3final11pages.docx, the on-going SSD work was intended for or submitted to the following journal/conferences:

1.1 One Unique Selling Point is a collective argumentation in crowdsourcing

Title:   A Collective Argumentation Framework and Its Application to Software Fault Diagnosis”

Title:   Probabilistic Crowd Argumentation and Its Application to Software Fault Diagnosis

Motivation is the crowdsourced testing, an emerging trend in software testing which exploits the benefits, effectiveness, and efficiency of crowdsourcing and the cloud platform. It differs from traditional testing methods in that the testing is carried out by a number of different testers from different places, and not by hired consultants and professionals. The software is put to test under diverse realistic platforms which makes it more reliable, cost-effective, fast, and bug-free. In addition, crowdsource testing allows for remote usability testing because specific target groups can be recruited through the crowd. Testing Pioneers like Cognizant Technology Solutions, Testbirds GmbH, Crowdsourced Testing, utest in project model, and a relatively new one 99 tests in contest model, have ventured into Crowdsource testing in the recent past. Please refer to Two Approaches to Crowdsourced Software Testing by Markus Steinhauser, Implementing Innovative Crowdsourced Testing: An Interview with Rajini Padmanaban by Wurst Noel, Crowdsourced Testing, Changing the Game by Vikas Hazrati, Crowdsource Testing by Yvette Francino - January 22, 2010, 1st International Workshop on CrowdSourcing in Software Engineering.

Based on the motivation of crowdsourcing, the Introduction can be organized in this way: Argumentation-based approach to web service composition, to agent negotiation, and to fault diagnosis ==> group thinking (collective decision making) in crowdsourcing

1.2 Another Unique Selling Point is a social diagnosis of software failures.

Title:   Social Failure Diagnosis in Software and Systems

Title:   Social Diagnosis of System and Software Problems

Title:   Social Diagnosis of Software Problems: Disputing in an Open Environment

The literature of software diagnosis research from Abreu, Wotawa onwards has highlighted the complexity and multi-faceted nature of software quality. A further important dimension of social diagnosis of software, especially in the background of web services and Web 2.0, is understanding that people test a software and assess its quality in very different ways.

This editors’ introduction on argumentation technology sheds some light on my thinking. In the absence of complete or accurate information, argumentation is a means to identify and organize what can be justifiably concluded, and to present it, systematically, to human users or to merge it with the justified conclusions of other machines.

We do not provide a general overview of troubleshooting software problems, which includes information about troubleshooting system crashes, managing crash dump information, and viewing and managing system messages. Instead, it is an attempt to handle incomplete and inconsistent information from multiple sources using argumentation to analyze all the information relevant to decision making when facing problems with software and systems. (face some or the other issue with this system)

Train of thought in Introduction. Background in software problems in the near future, their features (distributed, open participation, etc.). ==> What is social diagnosis of software problems? ==> Why is it different from traditional testing and debugging? and how do we implement social diagnosis?

Train of thought in Introduction. Trends in Web and software development ==> social SE ==> software problems in the near future, their features (distributed, open participation, etc.). ==> What is social diagnosis of software problems? ==> Why is it different from traditional testing and debugging? and how do we implement social diagnosis?

Train of thought in Section 2. reason for social diagnosis of service failures ==> motivation example ==> free debate vs. rigid debate ==> ground extension

Train of thought in Section 3.3 Properties of PAGs. joint path, depth ==> support component (nodes with zero in-degree), supporter ==> support component E.Q. acceptable arguments ==> loop in 2n steps, blacken node ==> support labeling algorithm

Train of thought in Section 4.1 Diagnosing service failures. process ==> process model ==> process execution model ==> PAM

More on questioned. related work,threats to validity

1.3 Solving Problem and Social Networking

  • “Social Networking Meets Problem Solving” reports that a new social network, called Jig, wants to solve your needs—with a little help from your friends. aims to be a place where users do more than just share personal news or play games. It’s a hangout where they can help solve one another’s problems. Collective Problem Solving Wiki is to facilitate the creation and use of these online problem-solving environments.

  • Social Software Engineering workshop is concerned with socialness of software engineering and the developed software, and people in this community include A. Felfernig, F. Lanubile. A book on Social Software Engineering: Development and Collaboration with Social Networking by Jessica Keyes. More than a handful of well-known software companies have developed collaboration tools (e.g. Microsoft’s SharePoint and Lync Server, Oracle’s Beehive, IBM’s Lotus Notes, Salesforce’s Chatter). A wide variety of free tools are available and may adapted for various purposes. Also: A survey of social software engineering by Ahmadi et. al..

1.2.4 A workflow loop as a motivating example

When I was designing a workflow loop for the purpose of motivating example, I happened to find that, (1) VMware’s vCenter Orchestrator (vCO) ships with a rich library of workflows and actions that can create workflow loop, (2) Nintex provide LOOP or For-each in the Workflow to iterate through all List Items, (3) The Workflow Patterns initiativee aims to provide a conceptual basis for process technology.

  • ECAI 2016 (2016-04-05 ~ 2016-04-15)

The ECAI2016 paper is a short version of the FSE2014 paper.

Title: A Two-Stage Probabilistic Argumentation Method for Aggregating Test Results from Crowds

The page limit for ECAI long papers is 8 pages, plus one (1) additional page for references only. The reference list may start earlier than page 9, but only references are allowed on this additional ninth page.

Train of thought in Introduction. Trends in Web and software development ==> social SE ==> software problems in the near future, their features (distributed, open participation, etc.). ==> What is social diagnosis of software problems? ==> Why is it different from traditional testing and debugging? and how do we implement social diagnosis?

1. Writing introduction informatively and critically 

  • 例1. A研究中的问题1 ==> 可行的办法, 然而问题1任然存在 ==> 新近出现的XXX有助于解决问题1 ==> 相关研究/应用 ==> 然而，与A有关的研究还不多见 ===> 本文的目的。。。

One challenging aspect of ... research is the constant struggle for data. Typically, researchers depend on ... who participate in studies in exchange for experience, course credit, or money. Research progress depends on the ebb and flow of the semester. As a result, it can take weeks, months, or even years to conduct a large behavioral study. This issue is even more salient for researchers at smaller universities.

One appealing solution is to collect behavioral data over the Internet. In theory, on-line experimentation would allow researchers to ... However, the main obstacle to conducting ... is finding ...

Recently, a number of ... services have been developed which connect ... with ... Perhaps the most popular system is ... Most importantly, there are a large number of people who use ...

There are a number of recent summaries about using ... for research.

However, less is known about the viability of conducting ... Such studies are unique in that they typically ... These features present two key challenges for on-line data collection. First, there are technical challenges in ... Second, experiments where memory and timing are important are likely more sensitive to incidental aspects of the testing environment that ...

The aim of the present paper is to validate ... as a tool for ... research, with a specific focus on ...

  • 例2. 为了啥 ==> ways investigated ==> Some existing techniques use … ==> Other techniques perform … ==> Still other techniques are based on …

To reduce the time required to locate faults, and thus the expense of debugging, researchers have investigated ways of helping to automate this process of searching for faults. Some existing techniques use coverage information provided by test suites to compute likely faulty statements (e.g., [1, 4, 5, 10, 12]). Other techniques perform a binary search of the memory state using one failing test case and one passing test case to find likely faulty statements (e.g., [2, 15]). Still other techniques are based on the remote monitoring and statistical sampling of programs after they are deployed (e.g., [6, 7, 8, 9]). Most papers reporting these techniques also report empirical studies that evaluate the presented technique in terms of its effectiveness and efficiency.

  • 例3. methods proposed ==> Some focus on … ==> Others focus on …==> progress, however, … ==> Because …, most methods cause … ==> why so complex ==> absence of spatial contextual info. ==> To address these limitations, we make effort to develop …

Many methods have been proposed to address the restoration of rain degradation. Some focus on video deraining [], []. Others focus on single image rain removal. These methods regard the rain streak removal problem as a signal separation problem [], or by relying on nonlocal mean smoothing []. These methods have made progress to some extent, however, they still suffer from some limitations. Because the rain streaks and background textures are overlapped intrinsically in the feature space, most methods cause non-rain regions to lose texture details and be over-smoothed.

The rain degradation can be complex, and previous widely used rain models (e.g., [], []) neglect some important visual factors of real rain images, such as the atmospheric veils caused by rain streak accumulation, and different shapes or directions of streaks. Moreover, many existing algorithms operate in a patch-wise way with a limited receptive field (a limited spatial range). Thus, spatial contextual information in larger regions is absent, which in fact has been proven to be useful for rain removal [].

To address these limitations, we make effort to develop a novel rain model that explicitly describes various rain conditions in real scenes, including rain streak accumulation and heavy rain, and then, design an effective deep learning architecture based on the novel rain model. Here, we focus on a single input image. Our ideas are as follows.

  • 例4. XXX of emerging concern ==> little is known ==> especially, severe lack of info. about ==> only way to screen ==> we propose The strong and widespread use of XXX, together with incorrect disposal procedures, has recently made these products XXX of emerging concern. Unfortunately, little is known about XXX’ environmental behaviour and ecotoxicity, so that EMEA (European Medicines Agency) released guidelines for the XXX’ environmental risk assessment. In particular, there is a severe lack of information about persistence, bioaccumulation and toxicity (PBT) of the majority of the thousands of substances on the market. Computational tools, like QSAR (Quantitative Structure Activity Relationship) models, are the only way to screen large sets of chemicals in short time, with the aim of ranking, highlighting and prioritizing the most environmentally hazardous for focusing further experimental studies.

In this work we propose a sreening method to assess 。。。, based on the application of two different QSAR models. We applied 。。。, implemented in QSARINS software and able to synthesize 。。。. Particular attention was given to the study of XXX in order to provide reliable predictions. An agreement of 86% was found between the two models and a priority list of 35 XXX was proposed for further experimental validation. Moreover, the results of this computational screening are in agreement with preliminary experimental data in the literature. This study shows how XXX models can be applied in the hazard assessment to perform preliminary screening and prioritization of chemicals, and how the identification of the structural features is particularly relevant to perform the rational a priori design of new, environmentally safer, pharmaceuticals.

  • 例5. increasing use of drugs ==> but overused ==>

In the last decades the improvement of welfare and life style has changed some demographic keys aspects leading to a population growth and also to a change in the age class ratio to benefit of the older age groups. The consequent increased demand for food and health care provisions has led to an enhancement in the use of human and veterinary drugs [].

Unfortunately, nowadays the pharmaceuticals are too frequently overused. The irrational use of pharmaceuticals products was well documented [], while overuse of medicine was assessed to push up health care costs and have negative consequences for societies and individuals []. The main example is the increased resistance of infectious microorganisms to many antibiotics due to the overuse of such pharmaceutical products in human and veterinary []. The expansion of medicine use is a clear phenomenon, so that some authors talk about society pharmaceuticalisation: “。。。” [].

This strong worldwide increased use of drugs has brought to a consequent increasing levels of detected and measured medicine residues in the environment, so now pharmaceuticals are widely recognized environmental contaminants of increasing concern, since they have been recently detected in more than 71 countries all over the world []. More than 600 Active Pharma- ceutical Ingredients (APIs) (or their metabolites and transforma- tion products) have been identified in the environment, mainly in surface water and sewage effluent, but also in groundwater, soil, and other environmental matrices [,].

。。。

Environmental presence of pharmaceutical products represents a scientific, technical and regulatory challenge and, in order to prevent the rise of negative impacts and to preserve good quality standards, environmental behaviour and effects of drugs need to be carefully assessed.

For these reasons the Environmental Risk Assessment (ERA) for human and veterinary products was taken in account by the European legislation and became effective with two EC Directives 2004/27/EC and 2004/28/EC. Currently, the ERA is performed ac- cording to the European Medicines Agency (EMEA) guidelines 。。。

Approximately 5000 active substances are currently on the market [], of which the majority are without information on their environmental behaviour. The need for an early identification and prioritization of the most environmentally dangerous substances, on which to focus the experimental tests, is thus evident.

In the past years different approaches, based on consumption, experimental toxicological and physico-chemical data and in silico predictions, were carried out to screen and identify the most en- vironmentally hazardous pharmaceuticals [,,].

In this work we apply to a big data set of pharmaceuticals a screening approach, based on QSAR models, that allows the identification of Persistent, Bioaccumulative and Toxic (PBT) chemicals directly from the molecular structure in absence of experimental data. QSAR () modelling is based on the assumption that the molecular structure of a chemical (i.e. its geometric, steric and electronic properties) contains the features responsible for its physical, che- mical, and biological properties. Such modelling techniques are the best chemoinformatic approaches to extract the information inherent in the molecular constitution and characterize the in- trinsic hazard of any chemical.

  • 例6. why important ==> several issues ==> However, existing methods typically ==> results in ==> Despite this gap in performance, this issue remains relatively unexplored ==> Recently, … ==> Although … promising, it has the following drawbacks ==> we address this issue by ==> To summarize, contributions 参考

often of poor quality ==> adversely affect the performance ==> With such algorithms becoming vital components in XXX, increasingly important to …

The task of XXX is plagued with several issues such as (i), and (ii) . For example, XXX developed .... In other work, .... Most recently, .... While these methods have achieved superior performance in obtaining high-quality XXX, they are inherently limited due to the fact that they are fully-supervised networks and they can only leverage fully- labeled training data. However, as mentioned earlier, obtaining labeled real-world training data is quite challenging and hence, existing methods typically train their networks only on synthetically generated XXX datasets.

The use of synthetic datasets results in sub-optimal per- formance on the real-world images, typically because of the distributional-shift between synthetic and rainy images. Despite this gap in performance, this issue remains relatively unexplored in the literature.

Recently, XXX [49] proposed .... ==> Although this method achieves promising results, it has the following drawbacks: (i), (ii), and (iii) .

Inspired by Wei et al. [49], we address the issue of incorporating unlabeled real-world images into the training process for better generalization by overcoming the drawbacks of their method. In contrast to [49], … Additionally, … Fig. 1 demonstrates the results of leveraging unlabeled data us- ing the proposed framework. Fig. 2 compares the results of the proposed method with SIRR [49]. One can clearly see that our method is able to provide better results as compared to SIRR [49].

To summarize, this paper makes the following contributions:

换个说法

  • XXX have been envisioned as the key enabler for XXX

  • XXX has been prevailing in XXX

  • Programs are complex artifacts, and debugging is often a struggle against complexity.

  • Recent developments in cognitive psychology suggest models for knowledge and learning that often fall outside the realm of standard test theory.

  • Over the last decades, a multitude of methods have been developed to help with XXX. This include for example: XXX [], or XXX []. All of these approaches rely on the availability of prior knowledge that is specific to a task. Moreover, they often bias the control policy in a certain - potentially suboptimal - direction.

  • Many approaches have been proposed to XXX. These include XXX [], and XXX [].

  • Numerous methods have been proposed to determine the number of non-trivial components as opposed to significant but trivial components. … All of these methods have been criticized for being either too subjective or too arbitrary.

  • Over the decades, many different types of rain removal techniques have been proposed and tested in …

  • there has been a great diversity of approaches and methodology developed for the single image rain removal, rather than a single unified deraining model that has proven to be most effective in practice.

  • It has a good capacity to keep texture details. However, it cannot handle the heavy rain cases when rain streaks are dense and significant. This problem is particularly acute if the sample size is large.

  • Today, when an industrial design concept is evaluated in an aesthetic manner, little or no consideration is given to geometrical variation.

2. Writing abstraction 

例1. In recent years there has been a considerable effort in advancing techniques for fault diagnosis. In this paper we present a novel fault diagnosis which integrates symbolic diagnostic inference with statistical fault localization to facilitates analysis and reasoning about uncertain program behavior. Using suspicious scores and runtime dependence information for multiple program runs, diagnostic rules are generated to characterize dynamic program behavior, particularly that associated with faults. Then symbolic diagnostic inference is used to isolate the most likely causes of the misbehavior detected by failing runs. The runtime cost of inference is optimized and our approach scales up well for large benchmark like Siemens suite. From the intensive experiments we carried out, we conclude that our approach is not only statistically more effective in fault localization than competitors like Tarantula, SOBER, CT, PPDG and LOUPE, but also has considerable improvements over available model-based software debugging in terms of diagnosis quality.

例2. In this paper an attempt is made to explore the logcial foundations of computer programming by use of techniques which were first applied in the study of geometry and have later been extended to other branches of mathematics. This involves the elucidation of sets of axioms and rules of inference which can be used in proofs of the properties of computer programs. Examples are given of such axioms and rules, and a formal proof of a simple theorem is displayed. Finally, it is argued that important advantages, both theoretical and practical, may follow from a pursuance of these topics.

3. writing descriptively 

  1. 约定 For ease of presentation, we summarize the notations in this paper in Table 2, where some will be introduced later.

  2. 对比 Compared with existing approaches [XXX] that employ some qualification tasks with ground truth to compute an average accuracy for all the microtasks, the highlight of our estimation is to consider accuracy diversity across microtasks. The basic idea is to infer the accuracy of a worker’s answer on a microtask based on her performance on the globally completed microtasks which are similar to the microtask. Speciﬁcally, as illustrated in Figure 2, …

  3. 组成/数据流 The framework takes as input XXX, and on-the-fly communicates with a XXX platform for doing sth.. It does sth. by using the following components. XXX component interacts with a XXX, and employs two modules, namely ACCURACY ESTIMATOR and MICROTASK ASSIGNER for what.

Writing problem statement

换个说法

  • With these definitions in place, we can define the goal of XXX as maximizing the sum of discounted rewards.

  • For brevity of notation, we will, in the following, omit the dependence of the expectation on samples from the transition and initial state distribution where unambiguous.

Referring back, and say something new

4. Writing critically 

The problems of big data

  1. 强调不足 Almost all previous work on model-based diagnosis has focused on persistent faults where the prior probability of component failure is provided by the manufacturer or estimated from fleet-wide service records. … It is very difficult to isolate intermittent faults which occur with low frequency but yet at high enough frequency to be unacceptable.

  2. 强调不足 A limitation of consistency-based diagnosis is that it is only capable of handling qualitative knowledge and unable to cope with the uncertainty that comes with many problem domains.

  3. 强调不足 The accuracy diversity in crowdsourcing engenders/causes/gives rise to many challenges, making existing solutions inadequate for producing high-quality result. On the one hand, a worker, who gives good answers to qualification tests, may not provide promising answers to other assigned tasks. As such, the existing approaches may over- or under-estimate workers’ accuracies and thus result in unreliable aggregated results. On the other hand, existing approaches neglect a fact that we can adaptively assign tasks to workers who have expertise on the tasks to further improve the quality, instead of random task assignment without considering workers’ expertise.

  4. 总结概括 Unlocking the potential of crowdsourcing in practice requires a multi-faceted understanding of principles, platforms, and best practices spanning different design verticals: pay-based (real or virtual) marketplaces like Amazon Mechanical Turk, entertainment-based Games with a purpose, and other motivational paradigms based on socialization, prestige, and/or contributing to society (e.g. Wikipedia, Aardvark, Community Q&A sites like WikiAnswers, charity sites like FreeRice, etc.).

  5. 总结概括 Statistical fault localization attracts many researchers’ interest [, guo06, , renieris03, , ball03sh, , jones02, , zeller02sh] because of its important applications in XXX. Usually they compare the passed and the failed program runs, but differ in what features are developed for comparison – they can be acyclic paths [, guo06], potential invariants, executed statements[, ball03sh, , jones02] , transitions, and basic block profiling [, renieris03] or program states[, zeller02sh].

  • It derives information such as the data type, length, value range, discrete values and their frequency, variance, uniqueness, occurrence of null values, typical string pattern (e.g., for phone numbers), etc., providing an exact view of various quality aspects of the attribute.
4辩论和博弈
5众包与人力计算(CHC)

众包(CrowdSourcing)是一个经济概念，是指雇佣大量廉价劳动力完成某种生产工作，达到低成本获得好结果的经济目的。通过将复杂的问题分解为简单、重复的人工智能任务(HITs, Human Intelligence Tasks)、招募互联网工人一起解决，众包为个人和商业提供了一种利用大众力量解决问题的新途径。众包最早见于2006年6月《连线》(wired)的一篇《众包的崛起》：企业利用互联网将工作分配出去、发现创意或解决技术问题。企业可以利用志愿者大军的创意和能力——这些志愿者具备完成任务的技能，愿意利用业余时间工作，满足于对其服务收取小额报酬，或者不计报酬。

以众包测试为例，国内小米、魅族、百度等公司都会有“内测期”、“公测期”这样的“众包”模式。众包测试的特点非常鲜明，在以下四个方面具有无可比拟的优势：

  • 快速迭代：采用“短平快”的流程，尽量把问题暴露在上游。

  • 极低成本：在某些产品的测试成本上，与其雇佣一个高级测试人员来编写 Python 自动化测试用例，还不如众包给一百个普通用户进行人肉测试。(后者甚至是免费的)

  • 获取需求：通过接近用户，可以获得最真实的用户需求。“智慧并非来自研究伟大的学说，而是来自观察平凡的事物。”

  • 树立品牌：通过组织社区，参与者会感到一种品牌建设的血缘关系，具有极高的黏性。

再以软件开发为例，约6万个功能模块、6000万行代码，由微软9千多名熟练的专业人士耗时5年完成的Vista，堪称传统软件工程开发的“登月工程”。在移动互联网的兴起中，苹果Appstore创造了应用开发、使用和销售的新模式，激发了Android、Chrome等一批应用商店，软件的规模和使用人数也以前所未有的速度增长。软件开发从封闭走向开放，开发人员从精英走向大众，通过分享、交互和群体智能，进行协同开发、合作创新和用户评价，产生低廉高质的软件。

现实生活中的很多生产和创意方式都符合典型的众包概念，在普查统计、用户调研、（图形图像、音视频、语料）标注[4]、心理学实验[3, 5]、数据挖掘、软件开发、软件测试、移动数据管理、音乐制作等现实任务中众包找到了用武之地。过去的几年里产生了很多众包平台，一些比较出名的众包平台有Amazon’s Mechanical Turk、TopCoder、CrowdFlower、Gun.io和Wikipedia等。crowdsourcing.org植根于工业界，报道有关众包的应用、市场、新闻事件等。Matthew Lease所在的Texas大学信息检索(IR)研究组归纳整理了与众包有关的新闻、活动和资源，包括会议、期刊、辅导讲座与讲演(tutorials and talks)、课程、软件等。这里有我们整理的综述。MIT群体智能中心把学校教职员召集起来研究人和机器如何一起更智能地工作，以及使其变为可能的潜在科学问题。CrowdDev是由伦敦大学学院博士生Ke Mao维护的众包软件开发的网站.

Amazon’s Mechanical Turk(AMT, 亚马逊机械土耳其人)是一个集雇佣和劳务的网络交易系统，它让用户可以雇佣互联网上的人完成一些简单地任务（HIT），并通过Amazon平台支付报酬[1]。发布的HIT一般是对于人简单易于完成，但对于电脑来说尚不好完成的任务，如语义理解、图像识别和跟踪等。AMT主要连接Requester，Task和Worker三个部分。简单地说，Requester在AMT平台上发布劳务信息，注册Worker可以在其上选择完成相应的任务，平台支付相应的报酬。AMT平台的主要任务是建立交易规则，进行评级(如给Worker打分)。AMT始建于2005年，已招募来自190个国家的50,000多人参加这一事业(has recruited over 500,000 individuals from 190 countries to the cause)，成为众多运行在AMT平台之上的其他众包平台的人才库[2]。

7计算社会选择

CSC Events | This semester’s seminar

Computational social choice (CSC) is an interdisciplinary field of study at the interface of social choice theory and computer science, promoting an exchange of ideas in both directions. On the one hand, it is concerned with the application of techniques developed in computer science, such as complexity analysis or algorithm design, to the study of social choice mechanisms, such as voting procedures or fair division algorithms. On the other hand, computational social choice is concerned with importing concepts from social choice theory into computing. For instance, social welfare orderings originally developed to analyses the quality of resource allocations in human society are equally well applicable to problems in multiagent systems or network design.

-- from the COMSOC research community

社会选择理论(Computational Social Choice)是研究如何表达和聚合个体选择的一门学问。最早可以追溯到公元前4世纪，兴起于18世纪。在过去的数十年里，计算机科学和互联网技术的迅猛发展给社会选择带来了一股新风，不但是许多新的应用，还有对选择表达和聚合的计算性观点。结果是出现了一个称之为计算社会选择的交叉学科，在人工智能、经济和计算性理论领域研究者中引起轰动。特别是，多智能体系统中智能体的选择是有冲突的，但它们必须要有达成联合决定，计算社会选择在许多多智能体系统条件下找到了自己的位置。

Social choice theory concerns the design and formal analysis of methods for aggregating the preferences of multiple agents. Examples of such methods include voting procedures, which are used to aggregate the preferences of voters over a set of candidates standing for election to determine which candidate should win the election (or, more generally, to choose an alternative from a set of alternatives), or protocols for deciding on a fair allocation of resources given the preferences of a group of stake-holders over the range of bundles they might receive. Originating in economics and political science, social choice theory has since found its place as one of the fundamental tools for the study of multiagent systems.

2014年张楠起笔的综述 (讲稿)    D:\rdings\chc\stories\

CSC Events 

  • COMSOC2014, June 23-25, 2014

    Fifth International Workshop on Computational Social Choice Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

    Submission deadline: March 15, 2014 (11:59pm EST)

    Notification date: April 15, 2014

Seminar Plan

This semester’s seminar referred to Ulle Endriss‘s course, and focuses on the topics as follows:

  • Tutorial

This tutorial will provide a brief introduction to CSC and complexity theory, and illustrate some of the problems we are going to address in this semester’s seminar, mostly by way of example. Everyone should have a look at this paper:

Y. Chevaleyre, U. Endriss, J. Lang, and N. Maudet. A Short Introduction to Computational Social Choice. Proc. 33rd Conference on Current Trends in Theory and Practice of Computer Science (SOFSEM-2007), Springer-Verlag, 2007.

  1. Voting procedures

  2. The axiomatic method in social choice theory, including natural and desirable properties that a voting procedure should satisfy, and two important impossibility theorems.

  3. Supplementary materials on complexity theory, including introduction to Turing Machines, undecidability, intractable problems.

  4. Three different approaches to characterising voting procedures

  5. Hard-to-compute rules

  6. Using computational hardness to prevent manipulation and other undesirable behavior in elections

  7. Further topics in voting

Online Courses

  • Computational Social Choice (course), by Ulle Endriss (ILLC, University of Amsterdam)

  • Computational Social Choice (IN2229), by Felix Brandt (DSS, Technische Universitaet Muenchen)

  • An introduction to game theory (course), by Martin J. Osborne

  • IJCAI-13 Tutorial: Computational Social Choice, by Lirong Xia

  • Tutorial on Computational Social Choice at ECAI-2010, and at TbiLLC-2011

  • Endriss‘s Computational Social Choice Seminar at ILLC, University of Amsterdam.

  • Computational Complexity course by Luca Trevisan

  • Introduction to Automata and Complexity Theory by Jeffrey D. Ullman

  • COST-ADT Doctoral School on Computational Social Choice, Estoril, Portugal, 9-14 April 2010

  • Ordinal Preference Aggregation: Social Choice

  • A Survey of Computational Social Choice: Theory and Applications, Committee Members: Prof. Fangzhen Lin (Supervisor)

  • computational complexity theory

  • tutorial on computational complexity, by Craig A. Tovey
